WarArchives.name: War Archives
WarArchives.help: Due to the lack of maintenance of war archives, continuous clear may not work normally, if Alas runs abnormally, Please manually finish clearing and use auto search

OpsiArchive.name: Archive Zones
OpsiArchive.help:
Clear archive zones. Archive zones are AP free.
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

OpsiMonthBoss.name: Monthly Boss
OpsiMonthBoss.help:
To clear (easy/difficult) monthly bosses, the following conditions must be met to use this function:
- Clear the main task of the big world
- Enable the Great World Land Reclamation Mission or use the Battle Information Recorder (5000 oil props)
If the easy difficulty fails, the attack will be repeated according to the submarine settings; if the difficult difficulty fails, the mission will be terminated directly

OpsiCrossMonth.name: Cross Month Daily
OpsiCrossMonth.help:
ALAS will enter OpSi 10min before OpSi reset, wait until OpSi reset but not exit OpSi. Then do the daily, obscure, abyssal and meowfficer farming to get extra gold plates. When running dailies, settings in task "OpSiDaily" are used, the rest function are the same.
    IMPORTANT: Please do not touch the game while ALAS is waiting for OpSi reset.

Enable.name: Enable Task
Enable.help:
Join this task to scheduler.
Task commission, research, reward are force to enable.

NextRun.name: Next Run
NextRun.help:
Updated automatically after completing the task to set next scheduled run, typically not manually modified
However you can force immediate scheduling if text field cleared

SuccessInterval.name: Success Interval
SuccessInterval.help: After successful, postpone next run for X minutes

FailureInterval.name: Failure Interval
FailureInterval.help: After failure, postpone next run for X minutes

ServerUpdate.name: Server Update
ServerUpdate.help: Series of server refresh time(s) as to when this task will next run, this is automatically converted to respective time zone, generally do not need to modify

Serial.name: Serial
Serial.help:
Common emulator Serial can be queried in the list below
Use "auto" to auto-detect emulators, but if multiple emulators are running or use emulators that do not support auto-detect, "auto" cannot be used and serial must be filled in manually
Default serial for select emulators:
- BlueStacks 127.0.0.1:5555
- BlueStacks4 Hyper-V use "bluestacks4-hyperv", "bluestacks4-hyperv-2" for multi instance, and so on
- BlueStacks5 Hyper-V use "bluestacks5-hyperv", "bluestacks5-hyperv-1" for multi instance, and so on
- NoxPlayer 127.0.0.1:62001
- NoxPlayer64bit 127.0.0.1:59865
- MuMuPlayer/MuMuPlayer X 127.0.0.1:7555
- MuMuPlayer12 127.0.0.1:16384
- MemuPlayer 127.0.0.1:21503
- LDPlayer emulator-5554 or 127.0.0.1:5555
If there are multiple emulator instances running, the default is reserved for one of them and the others will use different serials to avoid conflicts
Open console.bat and run `adb devices` to find them or follow the emulator's official tutorial

PackageName.name: Game Server
PackageName.help: Manual select is required if multiple game clients are installed on emulator

ServerName.name: Server in Game Client
ServerName.help:
Select the server where you are in the game to enable server status detection
Script will hang up when server is being maintained or network is broken

ScreenshotMethod.name: Screenshot Method
ScreenshotMethod.help:
When using auto-select, a benchmark will be performed and automatically changed to the fastest screenshot method.
General speed: DroidCast_raw >> aScreenCap_nc > ADB_nc >>> aScreenCap > uiautomator2 ~= ADB.
Run Tools - Performance Test to find the fastest method.

ControlMethod.name: Control Method
ControlMethod.help:
Speed: minitouch > Hermit >>> uiautomator2 ~= ADB
minitouch is recommended, hermit is not recommended unless on vmos

ScreenshotDedithering.name: Image Color De-dithering
ScreenshotDedithering.help: Enable when running Alas on phones

AdbRestart.name: Try to restart adb when no device found

_info.name: Emulator Settings
_info.help: The following values are auto-filled according to "Serial", if you don’t understand, please don't modify them

HandleError.name: Enable Exception Handling
HandleError.help: Handles select exceptions, will retreat if in battle

SaveError.name: Record Exception
SaveError.help: Records exception and log into directory for review or sharing

OnePushConfig.name: Error notify config
OnePushConfig.help:
When Alas cannot handle exception, send a message through Onepush. Configuration document: 
https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/Onepush-configuration-%5BEN%5D

ScreenshotLength.name: Record Screenshot(s)
ScreenshotLength.help: Number of screenshots saved when exception occurs

ScreenshotInterval.name: Take Screenshots Every X Second(s)
ScreenshotInterval.help: Minimum interval between 2 screenshots, limited in 0.1 ~ 0.3, can help reduce CPU on high-end PCs

CombatScreenshotInterval.name: Take Screenshots Every X Second(s) In Combat
CombatScreenshotInterval.help: Minimum interval between 2 screenshots, limited in 0.3 ~ 1.0, can help reduce CPU during battle

TaskHoardingDuration.name: Hoard Tasks For X Minute(s)
TaskHoardingDuration.help:
By purposely not adding ready tasks to pending, allows for larger subsets to be built and run en masse at a later time
Can reduce the frequency of operating AL

WhenTaskQueueEmpty.name: When Task Queue is Empty
WhenTaskQueueEmpty.help: Close AL when there are no pending tasks, can help reduce CPU

AzurStatsID.name: AzurStat ID
AzurStatsID.help: Used to identify your upload to <https://azur-stats.lyoko.io>, the ID consists of random characters and can be changed at any time

API.name: Upload API
API.help: If CN users cannot connect to AzurStat, recommend to use "reverse proxy"

RetireMode.name: Retirement Mode
RetireMode.help:
If mode is one click retire, in game retire settings are enforced
If mode is enhance but unable to do so, will fallback to one click retire as default

_info.name: One-click Retire Settings
_info.help: Only applies to "One-click Retire"

KeepLimitBreak.name: Keep Copies of Max LB Ships
KeepLimitBreak.help:
If you own multiple copies of a ship that has not been fully Limit Broken, this option determines what you want to do with those copies.
If one-click retire cannot retire ships, please set to "Don't Keep"

_info.name: Enhance Settings
_info.help: Only applies to "Enhance"

Filter.name: Ship Type(s) Filter for Enhance
Filter.help:
"cv > bb > ..."; may substitute a type with "?" to have Alas select a type at random
Must enter at least 1 whitespace character to disable type filtering

CheckPerCategory.name: Number Checked Per Category for Enhance
CheckPerCategory.help:
Restricts the number of ships to be checked per category before moving onto the next if any
Suitable enhance material is checked continously until reaching the unenhanceable state (in battle or stat full), after which this number is decremented for the current session
Recommend to configure 3+ if there are non-max level ships in active fleet else <= 2 is generally sufficient

_info.name: Old Retire Settings
_info.help:
Only applies to "Old Retire".
Note that old retire is based on rarity, it will retire Bulins

Name.name: Level Name
Name.help: 7-2, 12-4, or SP4; case insensitive; if the level is missing, please wait for next update

Event.name: Event Name
Event.help: Automatically selects to the latest event
Event.event_20200507_cn: The Way Home in the Night
Event.event_20200521_en: Iris of Light and Dark Rerun
Event.event_20200806_cn: The Enigma and the Shark Rerun
Event.event_20200820_cn: Scherzo of Iron and Blood Rerun
Event.event_20211028_tw: 復刻光與影的鳶尾之華
Event.event_20220526_cn: Pledge of the Radiant Court Rerun
Event.event_20221124_cn: The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets
Event.event_20231026_cn: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth
Event.raid_20200624: Air Raid Drills with Essex Rerun
Event.war_archives_20180726_cn: archives Iris of Light and Dark
Event.war_archives_20200507_cn: archives The Way Home in the Night
Event.war_archives_20200806_cn: archives The Enigma and the Shark
Event.war_archives_20200820_cn: archives Scherzo of Iron and Blood
Event.war_archives_20200903_cn: archives Stars of the Shimmering Fjord

Use2xBook.name: Use High-Efficiency Combat Logistics Plan
Use2xBook.help: Twice the oil consumption but also twice the exp and drops

_info.name: Stop Condition Settings
_info.help: After triggering any of following conditions, the current task will be stopped

OilLimit.name: Keep Oil Above X
OilLimit.help: Delay current task if oil is found to be below this number

RunCount.name: Run Level X Time(s)
RunCount.help: Automatically decreases by 1 for every completion and stops the current task upon reaching zero; saving as 0 implies unlimited runs until a different stop condition is met

MapAchievement.name: Level Achievement
MapAchievement.help: Stop current task if level has been 100% Clear, 3 Stars, Threat Safe, or Threat Safe without 3 Stars. Non-stop implies no achievement requirement and loops until different stop condition is met

StageIncrease.name: Enable Continuous Clear
StageIncrease.help:
Suited for 100% Clear, requires sufficient fleet strength and satisfying level attribute restrictions for every level involved
1-1 to 15-4, A1 to A3, B1 to B3, C1 to C3, D1 to D3, T1 to T6, SP1 to SP4

GetNewShip.name: New Ship Get
GetNewShip.help: Stop current task if detected new ship has been acquired

ReachLevel.name: Level X Reached
ReachLevel.help: Stop current task if any ship under level X has reached level X; saving as 0 implies no limit to the level.

_info.name: Fleet Settings
_info.help: Fleet 1 == Mob Fleet, Fleet 2 == Boss Fleet

Fleet1Step.name: Fleet 1 Step Number
Fleet1Step.help: Restrict tile step movement in non-cleared levels to configured number

Fleet2Step.name: Fleet 2 Step Number
Fleet2Step.help: Restrict tile step movement in non-cleared levels to configured number

FleetOrder.name: Fleet Roles
FleetOrder.help:
With non-auto-search, alas will pick up question marks and ammunition
With non-auto-search and battle <=4, Alas will force the use of "fleet1_all_fleet2_standby"

Mode.name: Submarine Mode
Mode.help: Effective only when auto search disabled. Reminder: 'Hunt and Boss' is actually a mix of 'Hunt Only' and 'Boss Only', it does hunt and summon submarines at boss if available.

DistanceToBoss.name: Before BOSS battle move the submarine near BOSS
DistanceToBoss.help:
Effective only if "Submarine Mode" is "BOSS Only" or "Hunt and BOSS"
Selecting "X Grids To BOSS" needs to ensure that the submarine hunting range can cover the BOSS. Distance is calculated using the Manhattan Distance. Selecting "Use Open Ocean Support" requires U522/Leonardo da Vinci in the submarine fleet.

_info.name: Emotion Settings
_info.help: At least one or both "Calculate Emotion Consumption" and "Ignore Low Emotion Warning" is used for these settings to be enabled

Fleet1Control.name: Fleet 1 Emotion Control
Fleet1Control.help: Measures will be taken to ensure control is maintained i.e. wait for recovery in level or stop current task if others can be executed while waiting

Fleet1Recover.name: Fleet 1 Recover Location
Fleet1Recover.help: Configure accordingly to accurately calculate emotion

Fleet1Oath.name: Fleet 1 All Oath
Fleet1Oath.help: +10/hr emotion recovery is included into calculation

Fleet2Control.name: Fleet 2 Emotion Control
Fleet2Control.help: Measures will be taken to ensure control is maintained i.e. wait for recovery in level or stop current task if others can be executed while waiting

Fleet2Oath.name: Fleet 2 All Oath
Fleet2Oath.help: +10/hr emotion recovery is included into calculation

_info.name: HP Control Settings
_info.help: Effective only if fleet lock is disabled

UseHpBalance.name: Use HP Balance
UseHpBalance.help: Enable monitor of HP across the front row ships and re-position them if needed

HpBalanceThreshold.name: HP Balance Threshold
HpBalanceThreshold.help: If the difference in HP volume is found greater than this threshold then Alas will re-position the ships

HpBalanceWeight.name: HP Balance Weight
HpBalanceWeight.help:
Assists in Alas to accurately monitor the HP volume
Enter your fleet data in the exemplified order "front-most, middle, back-most" --> "6000, 3000, 4000" (no quotations)

RepairUseSingleThreshold.name: Single Emergency Repair Use Threshold
RepairUseSingleThreshold.help: Use one repair kit if any one ship's HP is below this threshold

RepairUseMultiThreshold.name: Multi Emergency Repair Use Threshold
RepairUseMultiThreshold.help: Use all repair kits if the sum HP volume back or front row is below this threshold

LowHpRetreatThreshold.name: Low HP Retreat Threshold
LowHpRetreatThreshold.help: Retreat if the sum HP volume back or front row is below this threshold

_info.name: Enemy Priority
_info.help: Customize the priority of the enemy you want to fight

EnemyScaleBalanceWeight.name: Enemy Priority
EnemyScaleBalanceWeight.help: First clear the enemies on the mob to the boss, and then clean up other enemies according to priority

_info.name: C1-1 Affinity Farm Settings
_info.help: After entering, repeatedly moves between tiles to initiate ambush encounters

RunCount.name: Encounter Count
RunCount.help: Number of encounters until retreat and repeating again, recommended 32+

_info.name: C7-2 Mystery Farm Settings
_info.help: Performs minimum number of battles to acquire all mystery tiles then retreat and repeating again

StepOnA3.name: Step A3
StepOnA3.help: Effectively prevents mystery on A2 from being blocked

_info.name: C12-2 Medium Level Farm Settings
_info.help:
Use low strength fleet to level up at 12-2 and retreat after fighting all non-large escorts
Improve exp/oil consumption ratio by reducing strength of fleet

LargeEnemyTolerance.name: Large Enemy Tolerance
LargeEnemyTolerance.help: Number of large enemy battle(s) allowed before retreating

_info.name: C12-4 Large Level Farm Settings
_info.help:
Use high strength fleet to level up at 12-4 and retreat after fighting all escorts
Improve exp/oil consumption ratio by reducing strength of fleet

NonLargeEnterTolerance.name: Non-Large Enter Tolerance
NonLargeEnterTolerance.help: Retreat after configured number of battles if no large escorts are detected

NonLargeRetreatTolerance.name: Non-Large Retreat Tolerance
NonLargeRetreatTolerance.help: Number of battles allowed against non-large escorts after no remaining large escorts are detected

PickupAmmo.name: Pick Up Ammo
PickupAmmo.help: Number of battles before picking up ammo

_info.name: Commission Farming Settings
_info.help:
Warning: This task allows players to get a small amount of gems, but not an efficient way to farm.
Players who have recently started Azur Lane are easily superstitious about 0LB and low oil consumption, while being ignorant about character leveling.
Running this function will only make you feel fulfilled however in reality your account will not actually progress very much.
The main purpose of this task is to get extra cubes for players with a formed lineup. Please rationally treat gems as a by-product.

Fleet 1 is expected to consist of 1 0LB CV/CVL and 1 0LB Vanguard, Fleet 2 is expected to consist of support ships such as New Jersey or Shinano to provide external battle assistance.
For information about the drop mechanism/rate of urgent commissions, you can refer to <https://bbs.nga.cn/read.php?tid=27134956> (in Chinese Simplified)

ChangeFlagship.name: Change Flagship
ChangeFlagship.help:
Change flagship if flagship level >= 32 or either flagship or vanguard are emotion exhausted (if Change Vanguard is enabled). If you choose not to change, your fleet will ignore the low emotion warning and continue combat.
Switch out to new common CV/CVL whose level is in range of 1 to 31, after current has reached level 32+. Meanwhile, abandoned flagships will be retired. Any common CV/CVL whose level is 2+ will be regarded as targets. Do confirm that your own ships which is not a target has been locked

The flagship's equipment is replaced when being switched out by first recording the current setup
Only populated equipment slots will be replaced. If the CV/CVL preference has been configured, all 5 slots will be populated otherwise only the auxiliary slots will be populated.

ChangeVanguard.name: Change Vanguard
ChangeVanguard.help:
Change vanguard if flagship or vanguard are emotion exhausted. If you choose not to change, your fleet will ignore the low emotion warning and continue combat.
Switch out to new level 100(70) common vanguard from eagle or ironblood after current flagship has reached level 32+ (Only CN players'0 limit break ship can reach level 100)

The vanguard's equipment is replaced when being switched out by first recording the current setup. Only populated equipment slots will be replaced.

CommissionLimit.name: Prevent Too Many Urgent Commissions
CommissionLimit.help: When running 7x24, prevent having a lot of urgent commissions and not being able to complete daily commissions. It is recommended to select only short-terms and high-yields in the commission filter

PtLimit.name: Event PT Limit
PtLimit.help:
When the total PT reaches the given value, disable all event tasks. 0 means no limit. Cannot trigger instantly when using auto search
With this enabled, you only need to enable all the event tasks, and you don't need to count how many times to run

TimeLimit.name: Event Time Limit
TimeLimit.help:
When the local time exceeds the given value, disable all event tasks. '2020-01-01 00:00:00' means no limit and the time will be reset once it's triggered
This can prevent the occurrence of forgetting to disable event tasks after the event ends

_info.name: Task Balancer Settings
_info.help: Prevent coin shortage when farming event maps.

Enable.name: Enable Task Balancer
Enable.help: When enabled, the coin amount will be checked after each run.

CoinLimit.name: Keep Coin Above X
CoinLimit.help: Start chosen task if coin is found to be below this number.

TaskCall.name: Call task X if out of coin
TaskCall.help: Reminder: Players need to check task config before running, or TaskCall may not work.

LastStage.name: Last Event Daily Stage
LastStage.help: Automatically updated, skips completed levels in the filter, and resets at server reset time (00:00)

_info.name: Raid Daily Settings
_info.help:
Recommend manual play for faster contribution and climbing of prize ladder as raid points are awarded proportionally by speed
Enable task if slow contribution and climbing is acceptable
Fleet compositions must be made manually for each difficulty

StageFilter.name: Raid Daily Stage Filter
StageFilter.help:
Generally does not need to be modified or re-arranged but can do so if desired
Can save on oil consumption if less are attacked
Supports EX difficulty if specified, submarine is force called to increase clearing rate

_info.name: Maritime Escort
_info.help: Enter then retreat, get about 70% of maximum rewards

_info.name: Event Settings
_info.help: Fleets must be prepared manually in game before running

Mode.name: Mode
Mode.help: SP needs to use event daily SP to run

PresetFilter.name: Preset Filter Select
PresetFilter.help:
People without a basic knowledge of commission drops rates and spawn are recommended to use pre-optimized presets instead of writing custom filters
If the commission farming is running 24 hours a day, the (7x24 Commission Farming) filter should be used
It is not recommended to use the oil priority filter while running commission farming

CustomFilter.name: Custom Commission Priority
CustomFilter.help: To use your own filter, set "Preset Filter Select" to "Custom". All options have been defined at  <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/filter_string_en>

DoMajorCommission.name: Do Major Commissions
DoMajorCommission.help: 1200 oil commission is now outdated, the yield is very low, it is recommended to disable

TacticalFilter.name: Tactical Book Priority
TacticalFilter.help: Generally does not need to be modified or re-arranged but can do so if desired

RapidTrainingSlot.name: Use Rapid Training
RapidTrainingSlot.help: During events, use rapid training 10 times

_info.name: Control EXP Overflow Settings
_info.help:
Control waste amount of EXP on a specific book tier to save on time
For example, if remain = 1100, use ColorT3_Exp despite losing out on 100 EXP

Enable.name: Enable
Enable.help:
Disable for no overflow across all tiers
Otherwise enable then set specific tier's overflow for customization

_info.name: Level Skills
_info.help: When there is a vacant position in the Tactical Academy, the 1st slot ship girl in dock will be assigned as a student and improve any non-max level skill

Favorite.name: Use Favorite Filter
Favorite.help:
During student selection apply the favorite filter
Thereby, giving priority to certain ship girls
Apply the favorite status to a ship girl in-game

_info.name: Research Academy Settings
_info.help:
For convenience a few preset filters are provided
However it is recommended to use "custom" and author your own priority for projects
Note that combined with other settings, Alas will choose projects that satisfy all the conditions. For example, if "Use Cube" is disabled but your list consists of projects that cost cubes, Alas will not choose them

UseCube.name: Use Cube
UseCube.help: Allow to undertake projects that require cubes

UseCoin.name: Use Coin
UseCoin.help: Allow to undertake projects that require coins

UsePart.name: Use Part/Plate
UsePart.help: Allow to undertake projects that require parts/plates

AllowDelay.name: Delay research when resources are insufficient
AllowDelay.help:
When the resources are insufficient, Alas will delay research until the conditions are met or research queue is about to be emptied, which will not cause the research to stop
If the resources are insufficient for a long time or the time of running alas is not long enough, you can cancel this option to keep the research queue full

PresetFilter.name: Preset Filter Select
PresetFilter.help: See research drops rates and spawn rates in https://azur-stats.lyoko.io/. People without a basic knowledge of these are recommended to use pre-optimized presets instead of writing custom filters

CustomFilter.name: Custom Research Priority
CustomFilter.help: To use your own filter, set "Preset Filter Select" to "custom". All options have been defined at  <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/filter_string_en>

FeedFilter.name: Snack Filter
FeedFilter.help: Generally does not need to be modified or re-arranged but can do so if desired

_info.name: Event furniture Settings
_info.help: Buy time-limited furniture from dorm furniture shop during the event

BuyOption.name: Buy Option
BuyOption.help: buy set: buy one piece for each piece of furniture; buy all: Buy all furniture. Both buy options will remove the set of furniture from the forefront of the store. If buy set, remaining furniture will need to be manually buy. Difference in furniture price between the two options is not significant, Recommended to use buy all. This operation will not buy diamond furniture

LastRun.name: Last Check Time
LastRun.help: The time of the last check is recorded here to prevent the task from running repeatedly. Check interval is 6 days. This value is automatically recorded and generally does not need to be modified.

BuyAmount.name: Buy Amount
BuyAmount.help: The 1st meowfficer box purchase everyday is free

FortChoreMeowfficer.name: Do Fort Chores
FortChoreMeowfficer.help: Completes all 3 chores; clean, feed, and play with meowfficer to get fort exp

Mode.name: Meowfficer Training Mode
Mode.help:
Train Seamlessly means collecting trained meowfficer(s) every 2.5 ~ 3.5 hours.
Train Once a Day means collecting 1 trained meowfficer each day; emptying the training queue and do the enhancing on Sunday in order to finish weekly mission.

RetainTalentedGold.name: Retain Talented SR Meowfficer(s)
RetainTalentedGold.help:
During collection, SR cats are examined for special talent abilities i.e. has no tiers or is colored rainbow.
If detected these are locked to prevent being used as feed material. Players must manually check and enhance themselves an SR meowfficer's personal skill.

RetainTalentedPurple.name: Retain Talented Elite Meowfficer(s)
RetainTalentedPurple.help:
During collection, Elite cats are examined for special talent abilities i.e. has no tiers or is colored rainbow.
If detected these are locked to prevent being used as feed material. Players must manually check and enhance themselves an Elite meowfficer's personal skill.

EnhanceIndex.name: Enhance Index
EnhanceIndex.help: Index of target meowfficer to enhance. Limited in 1 ~ 12; indices are in ascending order from left to right of the 4 x 3 grid.

MaxFeedLevel.name: Do not use meowfficer larger than level X as enhancing materials
MaxFeedLevel.help: The X value is limited to 1 to 30

_info.name: Guild Logistics Settings
_info.help: Master or Officers must choose a guild mission manually

Enable.name: Enable Guild Logistics
Enable.help:
Enables the following:
- Accept and complete guild missions
- Submit items in exchange for guild coins
- Collect other guild rewards

SelectNewMission.name: Select A New Fleet Mission
SelectNewMission.help:
This account must be a guild master or officer to use this.
The easiest mission Siren Subjugation III is selected by default, and the objective is to defeat 300 enemies
(Not supported, please contact an EN developer if you would like to assist in alleviating this)

ExchangeFilter.name: Item Exchange Filter
ExchangeFilter.help:
Generally does not need to be modified or re-arranged but can do so if desired
If there is an item that you lack, priority for that exchange is lowered

Enable.name: Enable Guild Operation
Enable.help:
Enables the following:
- Start new / Join ongoing guild operations
- Dispatch ships to complete objectives
- Optionally attack guild boss when available

SelectNewOperation.name: Start New Guild Operations
SelectNewOperation.help:
This account must be a guild master or officer to use this.
The most rewarding operation Solomon Air-Sea Battle is selected by default

NewOperationMaxDate.name: Don't Start Guild Operation After Date X of Every Month
NewOperationMaxDate.help:
Only takes effect when "Start New Guild Operations" is enabled.
Starting a third operation in the same month is not recommended. Members are limited in joining up to 2 operations each month; a third operation will unlikely be finished as most cannot participate and spill over to the following month. This will affect the evaluation of the dispatch event, resulting in a reduction of the final reward

JoinThreshold.name: Join Threshold
JoinThreshold.help:
0.0 ~ 1.0
0.5 means only join when progress is less than halfway through
1 means join regardless of current progress even if basically finished
Remember you are limited to joining only 2 on a monthly basis
Maximize rewards and participation by joining newly started operations

BossFleetRecommend.name: Enable Fleet Recommend
BossFleetRecommend.help:
This will automatically select your own ships to fill all 6 ship slots
Recommended to keep disabled to form your own fleet along with fellow member's support units
However if members are frequently changing their support units, may be worth to enable otherwise attacks only with 4 ships

_info.name: Cognitive Awakening Settings
_info.help: Awaken all ships in dock til cognitive chips/arrays exhausted

BuySkinBox.name: Buy Equip Skin Boxes
BuySkinBox.help: In order to reduce maintenance costs, the skin box selectors in the filter will not be updated with the game, but Alas will consider any unknown items with a quantity of 1 and consume 7000 coins as skin boxes and buy them.

ConsumeCoins.name: Consume Spilled Coins
ConsumeCoins.help: Buy all items when the coins exceed 550000

Filter.name: Item Filter
Filter.help: All options have been defined at <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/reward_shop_filter_string>

Refresh.name: Allow Shop Refresh
Refresh.help: Refreshing will consume 50 guild coins, these are not valuable and it is recommended to have this enabled

Filter.name: Item Filter
Filter.help:
All options have been defined at <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/reward_shop_filter_string>
However unlike other shops you cannot specify the exact item, you are limited to just category and grade
The select options below are used to substitute this incapability

Filter.name: Item Filter
Filter.help:
All options have been defined at <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/reward_shop_filter_string>
Different from other shops, the below select options assist with filling the unknowns for the vague items 'Retrofit' and 'Plate'
Furthermore restricted for 'Plate', there are both specific and wild types
If you are targeting a specific type then use a string combination such as 'PlateGeneralT3 > PlateWildT3' otherwise 'PlateT3' will purchase every available T3 Plate
For research blueprints it is adviseable to use 'DR > PR', players should convert surplus into Prototype Core currency

Filter.name: Item Filter
Filter.help: All options have been defined at <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/reward_shop_filter_string>

Filter.name: Item Filter
Filter.help:
All options have been defined at <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/reward_shop_filter_string>
However unlike other shops, only Chip and Array are supported
ALAS does not browse, scroll, or recognize any other items displayed besides those two

_info.name: DR Blueprints Purchase Settings
_info.help: Purchase research blueprints every day, discount of DR and PRY blueprints are counted independently.

ShipIndex.name: Ship Index
ShipIndex.help:
Position varies depending on progress, so must manually verify the target ship's position yourself
Starting from left to right; 1 ~ 6

BuyAmount.name: Buy Amount
BuyAmount.help:
The 1st and 2nd purchase everyday are free
Discounts are applied to the 3rd and onwards, gradually minimizing until full price
Exact discounts found at <https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Research#Enhancing>

LastRun.name: Last Purchase Time
LastRun.help: Because AL does not display how many blueprints have been purchased today, the time of the last purchase is recorded here to prevent the task from running repeatedly. This value is automatically recorded and generally does not need to be modified.

ShipIndex.name: Ship Index
ShipIndex.help:
Position varies depending on progress, so must manually verify the target ship's position yourself
Starting from left to right; 1 ~ 6

BuyAmount.name: Buy Amount
BuyAmount.help:
The 1st and 2nd purchase everyday are free
Discounts are applied to the 3rd and onwards, gradually minimizing until full price
Exact discounts found at <https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/Research#Strengthening>

LastRun.name: Last Purchase Time
LastRun.help: Because AL does not display how many blueprints have been purchased today, the time of the last purchase is recorded here to prevent the task from running repeatedly. This value is automatically recorded and generally does not need to be modified.

_info.name: Gacha Settings
_info.help:
Submit new build order(s) for daily achievement
Previous orders will be dequeued before submission to allow for maximum inputs and if any are still in progress, drills will be used to expedite them
Retirement settings will be enforced if dock is full

UseTicket.name: Use Build Ticket(s)
UseTicket.help: Use build tickets first for event pool. Use cubes if tickets run out or build general pools

ForceCollect.name: Force Collect Data Key
ForceCollect.help: Force collect data key when data key is full to eliminate red dots

DeleteCollected.name: Delete Collected Mail Rewards
DeleteCollected.help:
Delete the already collected mail entries
Mark any entries "important" in-game to avoid accidental deletion

DayOfWeek.name: Days of the week
DayOfWeek.help:
Alas will delay free supply pack buying until the value
It is recommended to set it to weekdays, or alas may miss the purchase

UseDailySkip.name: Use Daily Skip
UseDailySkip.help:
Requires S Rank for respective missions to be unlocked
If not unlocked, then Alas will automatically fallback to traditional steps to complete the mission

SupplyLineDisruption.name: Supply Line Disruption Preference
SupplyLineDisruption.help: This will be skipped if daily skip has not been unlocked

_info.name: Hard Settings
_info.help:
Hard mode for chapter must be unlocked, stage must be in 100% CLEAR condition, and auto search is enabled temporarily.
Use Farm Main task to assist unlocking and achieving 100% CLEAR conditions

HardFleet.name: Hard Fleet
HardFleet.help: Must in game manually set up the fleet and ensure level attribute restrictions are satisfied

_info.name: Exercise Settings
_info.help: Runs exercise and automatically retreats when sum HP volume is low

ExerciseStrategy.name: Exercise Strategy (Keep X number remains)
ExerciseStrategy.help: If keeping 5 number remains, will try admiral at set time and clear number remains at last recover

LowHpConfirmWait.name: Low HP Confirm Wait
LowHpConfirmWait.help:
After HP is below the threshold, Alas will confirm the retreat after the configured period of time
Recommend 1.0 ~ 3.0
For cases if both you and the opponent are on the verge but waiting an additional seconds can be the difference between victory or loss

OpponentRefreshValue.name: Refreshed X Time(s)
OpponentRefreshValue.help:
Automatically updated, resets back to 0 daily
If you manually refresh, you should update this count

_info.name: META Assist Settings
_info.help: Limited to 3 everyday

Tier.name: Target Level Beacons >= X
Tier.help: If target level beacon cannot be found, Alas will choose the next available level beacon regardless of conditions

_info.name: OpSi General Settings
_info.help: All OpSi activities will use these settings

UseLogger.name: Use Logger(s)
UseLogger.help: Use all coordinate loggers when entering the storage

OilLimit.name: Keep Oil Above X
OilLimit.help: Refrain buying AP if below this number

RepairThreshold.name: Repair Threshold
RepairThreshold.help:
After completion of an OpSi map; if any one ship's HP is below threshold, retreat back to nearest port for repairs
0.0 ~ 1.0

DoRandomMapEvent.name: Do Random Map Events
DoRandomMapEvent.help: Rescan the whole map after auto search, purchase akashi's shop, use siren logging tower, use siren scanning device, unlock mechanism that require 2 fleets,

AkashiShopFilter.name: Akashi Shop Filter
AkashiShopFilter.help:
Generally does not need to be modified or re-arranged but can do so if desired
Buy AP boxes and Purple Coins

OneHitMode.name: One Hit Mode
OneHitMode.help:
Strike each beacon only once, then call for support every half hour thereafter
Not effective in META dossiers

DossierAutoAttackMode.name: Use Auto Attack Mode in META Dossier
DossierAutoAttackMode.help: Use Auto Attack Mode after the first battle

RequestAssist.name: Request Assists
RequestAssist.help:
Before the attack, request assists from friends, guild and world
Not effective in META dossiers

EnsureFullyCollected.name: Ensure 200 Beacon Data Fully Collected
EnsureFullyCollected.help: Ignore AP limit setting temporarily before ash beacon fully collected. "Meowfficer Farming" must be enabled

Filter.name: Fleet Filter
Filter.help:
All fleets take turns to attack the boss. If one fleet is dead, change to another.
Please make sure fleets are powerful enough to kill the boss eventually.
Use "CallSubmarine" to call submarines before the attack, but run interval will be increased to 60 minutes.

Submarine.name: Call Submarine
Submarine.help: If enabled, interval increases from 30 to 60 minutes instead

_info.name: OpSi Explore Settings
_info.help:
At the beginning of each month OpSi is reset
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
Each zone will be visited in a clockwise direction every 27 minutes until world has been been completely opened
No need to consume 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

SpecialRadar.name: OpSi Data Logger Bought (5k oil item)
SpecialRadar.help:
Purchase Operation Siren Data Logger is not a must, enable if you have purchased.
Allows Alas to explore OpSi continously without having to wait 27 minutes between each zone clear
Cannot be selected when not purchased and used manually

ForceRun.name: Force Run
ForceRun.help:
Ignore interval, clear all obscure zones, and use AP to submit scan orders (and submarine if enabled)
Generally not needed to force run, just run in intervals unless in a rush

LastZone.name: Last Zone Completed
LastZone.help:
Automatically updated with map ID
Replace with 0 to reset progress
Already completed zones will be skipped
Supports either Zone ID or Name in CN/EN/JP/TW, i.e. "51", "NA Ocean SE Sector E"

_info.name: OpSi Shop Settings
_info.help:
Completes OpSi daily activities
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop
Available only in the next month after clearing OpSi story, i.e., after the port shop becomes a new version of the shop

PresetFilter.name: OpSi Shop Filter
PresetFilter.help:
Generally does not need to be modified. Use "High value items and META material"` if Voucher Coins spilled or "Without META materials" if you are newcomer.
High value items include ActionPoint, Logger and T4 or higher items; META materials include METABook and META enhance materials.
PresetFilter.max_benefit_meta: High value items and META materials

CustomFilter.name: Custom Research Priority
CustomFilter.help: To use your own filter, set "OpSi Shop Filter Select" to "custom". All options have been defined at  <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/filter_string_en>

_info.name: OpSi Voucher Settings
_info.help:
Buy monthly items from the OpSi voucher shop
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete

Filter.name: Item Filter
Filter.help: All options have been defined at <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneAutoScript/wiki/reward_shop_filter_string>

_info.name: OpSi Daily Settings
_info.help:
Completes OpSi daily activities
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

DoMission.name: Do Port Mission(s)
DoMission.help: Accept and complete mission(s) from ports

UseTuningSample.name: Use Tuning Samples
UseTuningSample.help: Use all tuning samples and quality tuning samples

_info.name: OpSi Obscure Settings
_info.help:
Clear obscure zones every 27 minutes
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

ForceRun.name: Force Run
ForceRun.help:
Ignore interval, clear all obscure zones, and use AP to submit scan orders (and submarine if enabled)
Generally not needed to force run, just run in intervals unless in a rush

_info.name: OpSi Abyssal Settings
_info.help:
Clear abyssal zones
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

ForceRun.name: Force Run
ForceRun.help:
Ignore interval, clear all abyssal zones, and use AP to submit scan orders (and submarine if enabled)
Generally not needed to force run, just run in intervals unless in a rush

_info.name: OpSi Siren Stronghold Settings
_info.help:
Clear the weekly siren strongholds
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

ForceRun.name: Force Run
ForceRun.help:
Ignore interval, clear all siren strongholds, and use AP to submit scan orders (and submarine if enabled)
Generally not needed to force run, just run in intervals unless in a rush

_info.name: Monthly Boss
_info.help:
To clear (normal/hard) monthly bosses, the following conditions must be met to use this function:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop
If failed on normal boss, attack until cleared; if failed on hard boss, stop task directly

ForceRun.name: Force Run
ForceRun.help:
Ignore interval, clear all abyssal zones, and use AP to submit scan orders (and submarine if enabled)
Generally not needed to force run, just run in intervals unless in a rush

_info.name: OpSi Meowfficer Farm Settings
_info.help:
Attack target zones of the specified hazard level in a clockwise direction
The following must be satisfied:
- OpSi story and practice battles must be complete
- Task OpSi Explore enabled or consuming 5000 oil for special radar in OpSi voucher shop

ActionPointPreserve.name: Keep X Amount of AP
ActionPointPreserve.help:
Stops task if total AP (including AP boxes in inventory) is below this number, 1000 is recommended
This value will be auto reduced to 300 at 3 days before OpSi reset, or 1000 if CL1 leveling enabled, and to 0 at day before reset

HazardLevel.name: Target Zone Hazard Level
HazardLevel.help: Recommend 3 or 5 as these have higher meowfficer ratio to AP cost

TargetZone.name: Target Zone ID
TargetZone.help:
Supports either Zone ID or Name in CN/EN/JP/TW, i.e. "51", "NA Ocean SE Sector E"
If specified, Alas will loop on this same zone after each clear
Use default value 0 or clear the field to remove the specification
Zone information can be acquired from <./module/os/map_data.py>

_info.name: CL1 leveling
_info.help:
Consume operation coins to gain a lot of experience and a little action points.
Recommended to carry 1-2 pre-loaded CV to obtain the highest average hourly benefit.

To avoid being unable to buying goods from port shops, Alas will retain 100,000 operation coins
Since buying action points at the mystery shop requires a large number of operation coins, this function will be supplemented by running meowfficer farming with overflow action points.

TargetZone.name: Target Zone ID
TargetZone.help: Only attack target zone, which can be used to avoid the event that the map cannot be refreshed due to game bug

_info.name: Semi-auto Clicking
_info.help:
Useful when attacking a stage that has not yet been adapted by Alas, can save on tons of manual clicks
Alas will click combat preparation, click combat drop, skip story, auto-retire, and close popups
You only need to move your attacking fleet if movement is restricted and choose the enemies yourself

EnterMap.name: Auto Click Stage Preparation
EnterMap.help: Prepare your fleets before running this tool if enabled

_info.name: OpSi Semi-auto Clicking
_info.help:
Useful when attacking logger zones or OpSi story, can save on tons of manual clicks
Alas will click combat preparation, click combat drop, skip story, and close popups
You only need to choose the enemies and switch to different zones yourself

RepairShip.name: Repair Ships When Nearing Port
RepairShip.help:
Once a fleet is in range of a port, Alas will enter, repair your ships, then exit
When it is done, please move the fleet away and out of range from the port within 30s, otherwise the actions will be repeated

SelectEnemy.name: Clear nearby enemies and resources
SelectEnemy.help: Clean nearby enemies and resources, and find new enemies or materials after cleaning, which usually clears the entire map. If some of them haven't been cleared, you need to solve them manually

_info.name: Performance Test
_info.help:
Test which screenshot method and click method combination is the fastest and best for you.
Speed can vary on the emulator being used and your PC build.
After testing, select the fastest screenshot and control method in "Alas" - "Emulator Settings"

DeviceType.name: Device Type
DeviceType.plone_cloud_with_adb: Phone clouds with public network ADB
DeviceType.phone_cloud_without_adb: Phone clouds without public network ADB

_info.name: [CN] Uncensored Patch
_info.help:
Applicable to CN only
AzurLaneUncensored files are downloaded if not present otherwise updated to the latest revision
These files are then pushed into the emulator and restarts AL afterwards to complete the patching process

Repository.name: AzurLaneUncensored Repository
Repository.help:
Do not need to modify
Github: <https://github.com/LmeSzinc/AzurLaneUncensored>
CN mirror: <https://e.coding.net/llop18870/alas/AzurLaneUncensored.git>

_info.name: Game Manager
_info.help: This is a semi-finished product, currently only implemented to force close the game and start it after closing.

AutoRestart.name: Automatic Login
AutoRestart.help: Log back into the game when the game has been ended.

_info.name: Task status
_info.help: Store internal status of the task. Clear manually when the task is abnormal

Toast.DisableTranslateMode: Click here to disable translate mode
Toast.ClickToUpdate: New update available, click here to update

AddAlas.FileExist: A config with the same name exists, please choose another one
AddAlas.InvalidChar: Config name cannot contain any of the following characters: .\/:*?"<>|

AppManage.NameExist: A config with the same name exists, please choose another one
AppManage.InvalidChar: Config name cannot contain any of the following characters: .\/:*?"<>|
AppManage.OverrideWarning: This will override the current config!
AppManage.Name: Name

Update.UpdateWait: Waiting for all alas complete current task
Update.UpdateFailed: Update failed. Logs can be found in ./log/*_gui.txt
Update.Author: Author
Update.DisabledWarn: Updater module is disabled. You need to manually restart Alas to update

Remote.NotRunning: Not running, server disconnected or offline
Remote.NotEnable: Disabled, set webui password in deploy.yaml and enable remote access
Remote.SSHNotInstall: No SSH command in your system. Please refer to the tutorial to download or install one
